goal_name: A nation that ensures our food and nutrition security needs are adequately met for all people through increasing sustainable food production systems and improving household production
target_name: Increase agricultural and fisheries food production using sustainable practices to ensure sufficient access to affordable and nutritious food
indicator_name: Proportion of households engaged in production of food for own consumption
GoalDescription: A nation that ensures our food and nutrition security needs are adequately met for all people through increasing sustainable food production systems and improving household production
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Increase agricultural and fisheries food production using sustainable practices to ensure sufficient access to affordable and nutritious food
IndicatorDescription: Proportion of households engaged in production of food for own consumption
ComputationMethod: Total Number of Households engaged in production of food for own consumption divided by total number of households multiply by 100
Concept: Production means growing the plants we harvest or raising the animals we use for food. Most food comes from domesticated animals and plants, and their production occurs on farms or ranches. Some foods are caught or harvested from the wild, such as fish, pigs, cows, etc.
DataSource: VNSO (Census, NSDP Survey, Mini-Census) , Department of Agriculture (Administrative Data)
Definition: Food production is the process of transforming raw ingredients into prepared food products. Food production includes industries that take raw food products and convert them into marketable food items.
Dissaggregation:
* Area Council Level
* Provincial Level
* National Level
* Type of Food Production
Rationale: Own production of food consumption , is related to the production of food and agricultural products. This includes crop production, livestock production, fisheries and aquaculture production, and from forestry production.
source_organisation_1: 2009 Population and Housing Census, VNSO (published figure in 2014 Socio-Economic Atlas p 52)
source_organisation_2: 2014 National Accounts Annual Report Vol 4 (p29), VNSO
